page.title: 03St.Paul's Cray Village-work
page.content:
We have carried out a survey about employment, and transport. 69 questionnaires were filled in.
{Employment and Transport} From our survey we discovered that in St. Paul's Cray the most common types of employment for women are secretary, cook, dinner lady, teacher and shop assistant. For men the most common types of employment are driver, engineer, supervisor, policeman and accountant. The most common work for women is being a mother or housewife. In our survey 71% go to work outside St. Paul's Cray. 64% get to work by car, 4% go by bus, 3% by train but none walk, whereas of the people who work in St. Paul's Cray 16% go by car, 6% by bus and 3% walk. The most popular form of transport is the car. 86% of the people have cars, whilst 14% do not.
